question: 促す
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>urge</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to urge</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Someone with a weird accent is trying <vocabulary>to urge</vocabulary> you to eat "Unagah" (<ja>うなが</ja>). This person really means "unagi," and this person also doesn't realize how delicious unagi is (and thinks he's tricking you). You ask him what "Unagah" is. Go ahead and say it out loud.
